titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Moses Papers
titlestmt.author: by John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:03

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Mimeographed and printed matter, together with a few photocopies of letters, compiled by Robert Moses. These form a record of projects which he sponsored or was connected with, particularly the New York World's Fair (1964-1965), the Power Authority of the state of New York and the Triborough Bridge Authority. Also clippings of newspaper and magazine articles by and about him, texts of speeches and reports by agencies of which he was a member.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Moses Papers (MS 360). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Robert Moses, 1966-1970; and Mrs. Robert Moses, 1981; part transferred from the Harold Phelps Stokes Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Robert Moses Papers consist of only mimeographed and printed material, and a few photocopies of letters. (Most of Robert Moses' papers are at the New York Public Library.) The bulk of this material was arranged and bound in 38 volumes by Moses; he also prepared a table of contents to each volume. Annotated photocopies of these tables of contents will be found in the appendix to this register; they provide a detailed, item-by-item listing of most of the collection. However, there are also some materials not bound in volumes. These are arranged chronologically and boxed at the end of the collection, and there is no detailed listing of them.

Some of the papers were given to Yale by Robert Moses. Others were removed from the Harold Phelps Stokes Papers, Ms No. 645; that collection still contains the many letters of Moses to Stokes. Finally, two mimeographed speeches were donated by Frank Monaghan. Parts of the collection were formerly catalogued as books, under the call no. Yz.909.M.
Note: Item numbers in Inventory correspond to item placement within bound volumes.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Robert Moses (1888-1981): public official; Parks Commissioner of New York City, 1934-1960; Pres., N.Y. World's Fair 1964-1965; special adviser to N.Y. Governor on housing, 1974-1975; named New Yorker of Year, N.Y. Daily News, 1956; numerous subsequent awards, medals and honors for accomplishment in public service.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials are listed in the order bound within the volume. Researchers should note that the contents list at the beginning of the volume list the Articles by Robert Moses first, but the articles of Moses are in fact bound after the speeches.
